title: 109_hr3988
content:
The Act titled "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes small businesses in procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" gives priority to businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas for procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. Small businesses in these areas must receive at least 30% of prime contracts and 40% of subcontracts. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" mandates that Federal departments prioritize small businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas for procurement. Small businesses must receive opportunities for participation, comply with subcontracting goals, and a report must be submitted to Congress within 2 years. This subsection will terminate one day after all Federal Disaster Declaration notices for Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas are lifted. SEC. 3. Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small businesses treated as HUBZone for program purposes. Applies during Federal Disaster Declaration period for affected county as of August 28, 2005.

SEC. 4. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. No facility of the Federal Government can be permanently relocated from a Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area to a location outside that area. Termination after two years from enactment. Reports required for facilities temporarily relocated for over 6 months. Reports to be submitted every 6 months on the status of the temporary relocation. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS.

(a) Gulf Hurricane Disaster-Affected Small Business Concern: Refers to a small business in a Gulf hurricane-affected area as of August 28, 2005.
(b) Gulf Hurricane Disaster: Event caused by Hurricane Katrina or Rita declared a major disaster by the President.
(c) Gulf Hurricane Disaster-Affected Area: County or parish in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, or Texas designated for disaster assistance due to Hurricane Katrina or Rita.
(d) Small Business Concern: Defined under section 3 of the Small Business Act.

SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. The Act will be effective 10 days after its enactment.
